column4: does anyone know how to remove an encrypted volume created using the ubuntu 8.10 alternate cd?
You created an LVM + Encryption system?
yes, I'm still in the installer too
I configured the encrypted volume and now I want to remove it and set it up differently.
I gave it all the space and I didn't leave any non-encrypted for windows xp
and now I can't delete the physical volume because it's inuse by the encrypted volume which I also can't seem to remove completely.

If you're using alternative disc, it's a little complicated because of the interaction between the user and the menu.  It's menu-driven so some things will appear as if you're doing nothing and other things, you'll be able to change.  You need to destroy the partition and create a new (smaller) partition.
how to destroy the encrypted volume so I can destroy the physical volume?
You already have Windows XP partition installed?
nope.  That would be nice :)  I currently have no operating system installed
Just make a new partition over everything.
Or just a small partition (with room for XP).
the problem is I can't delete the partition I have
Why not?  You want to keep certain files?
no it says I can't modify the volume because it is in use by the encrypted volume
I found that aborting the installer and restarting allowed me to modify what I wanted.
